spells.description: This spell evaporates moisture from the bodies of all living creatures in the area, dealing 1d8 damage per caster level. A successful save halves the damage. Water elementals and plant creatures save at –2. The spell has no effect on undead or constructs. The material component is a bit of sponge.

spells.name: Airboat
spells.description: The caster targets a cloud, which descends and transforms into a vessel of the caster's imagining. The craft can be any shape (boat, chariot, etc.) and moves under control of the caster’s mental commands. It moves in any direction and medium, including underwater and airless space. Oars may be required for propulsion. The airboat hovers if the caster stops concentrating, but sinks gently after 1 turn.

spells.name: Analyze Dweomer
spells.materials: a tiny lens of ruby
spells.description: Reveals all spells, enchantments, or magical properties on a creature or object. One feature is discovered per round, in the order they were cast or acquired. Base 50% chance to identify each, plus 2% per caster level (max 99%). Artifacts and relics remain inscrutable. The caster must pass a system shock roll or be exhausted for 1d8 hours. Material component: A ruby or sapphire lens worth 1,000 gp.

spells.name: Antipathy-Sympathy
spells.materials: a lump of alum
spells.description:
Causes targeted creatures to feel an intense emotional pull:

- *Antipathy*: Targets are repelled unless they save vs. spell. On success, they suffer a –1 Dex penalty each round (max 4).
- *Sympathy*: Targets are drawn to the location or item. If they fail a save, they cannot resist staying or holding it.

The spell affects a 10-ft. cube per level or one object, and requires specific creature type or alignment to be named.

spells.name: Bigby's Clenched Fist
spells.materials: a leather glove and a small device
spells.description:
Summons a massive magical fist that strikes one target each round, dealing damage based on a d20 roll:

- 1–12: 1d6 (glancing)
- 13–16: 2d6 (solid)
- 17–19: 3d6 + stun 1 round
- 20: 4d6 + stun 3 rounds

Stunned foes make future attacks easier (+4 to roll). The fist has AC 0 and HP equal to the caster’s max HP. Material component: A leather glove and a copper-zinc alloy knuckle device.

spells.name: Binding
spells.description: Creates a magical restraint to hold a creature, often extraplanar. Requires a circular diagram or physical bonds, depending on the subject. Duration varies based on binding type, caster level, and ritual time. Components vary but include special metals, rare herbs, gems (1,000 gp/HD), and a depiction of the target. True names bypass magic resistance. Saves are negated if the caster's level is twice the target’s HD.

spells.name: Clone
spells.materials: a small piece of the flesh
spells.description: Grows a duplicate of a person from a sample of their flesh. If the original dies, their soul may transfer to the clone (if within 1,000 miles), restoring life. If both original and clone live, the clone has partial memories and becomes a rival. Growing the clone takes 2d4 months. It must be kept safe and cared for during this time. Material component: a piece of the subject's flesh.

spells.name: Demand
spells.materials: a pair of cylinders
spells.description:
This spell is very much like the 5th-level wizard spell *sending*, allowing a brief contact with a far distant creature. However, with this spell the message can also contain a *suggestion* (see the 3rd-level wizard spell *suggestion*), which the subject will do its best to carry out if it **fails its saving throw vs. spell**, made with a **-2 penalty**.

If the message is **impossible or meaningless** according to the subject's current situation, it is understood, but **no saving throw is necessary** and the suggestion has no effect.

The caster must be **familiar with the creature contacted** and must know its **name and appearance well**.

- If the creature is **not on the same plane of existence**, there is a base **5% chance the demand fails** to arrive.
- Local conditions on other planes may worsen this chance, at the DM's discretion.

If the demand is received, it is understood even by creatures with **Intelligence as low as 1**. Creatures of **demigod status or higher** may choose to ignore the demand entirely.

The **demand message** must be **25 words or less**, including the suggestion. The creature may send back a **short reply immediately**.

spells.name: Estate Transference
spells.materials: the appropriate magical device
spells.description:
This powerful spell allows a caster to transfer a **large area of land** in the Prime Material Plane to **any of the elemental planes**. All buildings, people, and wildlife within the area of effect are also transported.

The land forms a **pocket of the Prime Material** within the elemental plane:
- The pocket is a **sphere** equal in diameter to the land area.
- The **surface** allows creatures to pass, but blocks elemental intrusion.
- Inside: normal air (matching the Prime Material at the moment of transfer) and a source of water.

The area must be **ringed by solid markers** made from material native to the destination plane, placed no more than five feet apart.

The wizard must be **within the area** during casting. Once moved, the land **cannot be moved again** using this spell.

If the **control device** (a magical item for commanding elementals) is disturbed, the spell **fails**, and elemental energies flood the pocket.

The control device is consumed in the casting and must be placed at the heart of the estate.

spells.name: Glassteel
spells.materials: a small piece of glass
spells.description:
The *glassteel* spell turns normal, nonmagical crystal or glass into a transparent substance with the **tensile strength and unbreakability of actual steel**.

- Affects up to **10 pounds per caster level**.
- The material must be one whole object.
- The resulting Armor Class is **1**.

Material components: **a small piece of glass and a small piece of steel**.

spells.name: Greater Permanency
spells.description:
This powerful version of *permanency* allows magical effects to be made **permanent** upon objects or creatures.

- Must follow casting of a compatible spell.
- Each use **reduces the caster's Constitution by 1 point**.
- Effects can only be **dispelled by a caster of higher level**.

**Spells usable on the caster only**:
*comprehend languages, detect evil, detect invisibility, detect magic, infravision, protection from cantrips, protection from evil, protection from normal missiles, read magic, tongues, unseen servant.*

**Spells usable on objects or areas**:
*enlarge, fear, gust of wind, invisibility, magic mouth, prismatic sphere, stinking cloud, wall of fire, wall of force, web.*

**Spells for objects/areas only**:
*alarm, audible glamer, dancing lights, distance distortion, solid fog, teleport, wall of fire.*

Permanency may fail after 1,000 years. Other spells may be researched for use, subject to DM approval.

spells.name: Gunther's Kaleidoscopic Strike
spells.description:
A beam of **shimmering, kaleidoscopic light** shoots from the caster's fingertips toward a target.

- Has **no effect** on non-spellcasters or creatures with innate spell-like abilities.
- **Wizards and priests** may lose memorized spells.

**Effect**:
- The number of spells drained = *caster's level - 1d20*.
- If the result is 0 or less, **no spells are lost**.
- Lost spells are selected starting from **1st-level upward**, and chosen randomly.

Lost spells must be **rememorized**.

spells.name: Heart of Stone
spells.materials: the stone heart itself.
spells.description:
This potent spell replaces the caster’s heart with a **perfectly crafted stone heart**, changing the caster’s body and essence.

- The caster gains immunity to **nonmagical diseases**, **poison**, **charm**, and **fear**.
- The caster becomes **undetectable by spells that detect life or emotions**.
- The transformation is **irreversible** by normal means.

If the stone heart is **damaged or destroyed**, the caster **dies instantly**.

Material component: **the crafted stone heart**, which must be prepared in advance.

spells.name: Homunculus Shield
spells.materials: a miniature sculpted bust
spells.description:
### Homung (Abjuration)

This spell **banishes a creature to a random plane of existence**.

- A successful **saving throw negates** the effect.
- If failed, the creature (and carried items) are sent to a **random plane**.

**Notes**:
- The caster **cannot choose** or influence the destination.
- The conditions on the plane may be deadly or merely challenging.
- Random tables (see sourcebook) determine the target plane.

spells.name: Homung
spells.description:
### Homunculus Shield (Evocation, Necromancy)

The caster **externalizes a fragment of his mind** as a magical homunculus, which appears as a miniature version of the caster.

- The caster can act normally while the homunculus casts **teleport, contingency, or protective spells (4th level or lower)**.
- Spells are cast from the caster's memorized list and use **1-round casting time**.

- The homunculus has **1 hit point per 2 caster levels**, reducing the caster’s own hit points.
- It cannot be attacked separately but may be damaged by **area effects**.

At the end of the duration, the homunculus vanishes, and hit points may be restored only by **magical healing**.

While active, the caster suffers a **-4 penalty to saving throws vs. magic jar**.

spells.name: Incendiary Cloud
spells.materials: fire source, scrapings from beneath a dung pile, and a pinch of dust
spells.description:
This spell creates a **billowing cloud** that bursts into flame after 3 rounds.

- Round 3: **1–2 damage per caster level**.
- Round 4: **1d4 damage per caster level**.
- Round 5: **1–2 damage per level** as it burns out.
- Subsequent rounds: harmless **obscuring smoke**.

Creatures save once; on a fail, they must re-save in rounds 4 and 5 to halve damage.

**Material components**: a fire source, dung scrapings, and a pinch of dust.

spells.name: Iron Body
spells.materials: a small piece of iron
spells.description:
The caster’s body is transformed into **living iron**, gaining powerful defensive abilities:

- Only harmed by **+3 blunt weapons** or creatures with **8+3 HD or more**.
- Immune to **slashing**, **falling**, **constriction**, and **physiological spells** (e.g., poison, enfeeblement).

While protected, the caster cannot cast spells or use Dexterity bonuses, but becomes virtually immune to most attacks.

Material component: **a small piece of iron**.

spells.name: Mass Charm
spells.description:
This spell affects multiple targets as *charm person* or *charm monster* would.

- Affects creatures whose total **Hit Dice or levels** do not exceed **twice the caster’s level**.
- All targets must be within **spell range** and inside a **30-foot cube**.
- Targets suffer a **-2 penalty** on their saving throws.
- Wisdom bonuses still apply.

Note: The number of targets does **not** affect their saving throw chance.

spells.name: Maze
spells.description:
This spell causes the target to vanish into a **labyrinthine extradimensional space**.

- Duration depends on the **Intelligence** of the creature:

| Intelligence | Duration Trapped |
|--------------|------------------|
| Under 3      | 2d4 turns         |
| 3–5          | 1d4 turns         |
| 6–8          | 5d4 rounds        |
| 9–11         | 4d4 rounds        |
| 12–14        | 3d4 rounds        |
| 15–17        | 2d4 rounds        |
| 18+          | 1d4 rounds        |

Minotaurs are **immune** to this spell.

**Teleport** and **dimension door** do not help; only **plane shift** may allow escape.

spells.name: Mind Blank
spells.description:
Grants the target **complete immunity** to all spells and devices that:
- Detect emotions or thoughts
- Influence behavior
- Read the mind or divine intent

**Protection includes**:
*augury, charm, command, confusion, divination, empathy, ESP, fear, feeblemind, mass suggestion, phantasmal killer, possession, rulership, soul trapping, suggestion, telepathy,* and related spells.

Also blocks **crystal balls**, **scrying**, **clairvoyance**, **contact other planes**, and **wish-based** detection.

**Note**: Exceptionally powerful deities **may still penetrate** the protection.

spells.name: Monster Summoning VI
spells.materials: a tiny bag and a small candle
spells.description:
Functions like *monster summoning I*, but:
- Summons **1d3 6th-level monsters**.
- Creatures appear in **1d3 rounds**, within the spell’s area.
- They attack the caster's foes until slain, dispelled, or dismissed.
- Monsters are fearless and **vanish upon death**.

If no enemies are present, summoned creatures may perform **other services** if the caster can communicate with them.

**Material components**: a **tiny bag** and a **small candle**.

spells.name: Otiluke's Telekinetic Sphere
spells.materials: a pair of small bar magnets
spells.description:
### Otiluke’s Telekinetic Sphere (Evocation, Alteration)

Creates a **globe of force** identical to *Otiluke’s resilient sphere*, with enhanced telekinetic properties.

- Encapsulated contents weigh **1/16 normal weight**.
- The caster may telekinetically **move the sphere** (up to **5,000 lbs.**).
- Control range: **10 yards per caster level** after capture.

Contents are largely safe from damage while encapsulated.

**Material component**: a **pair of small bar magnets**.

spells.name: Otto's Irresistible Dance
spells.description:
When an Otto's irresistible dance spell is placed upon a creature, the spell causes the recipient to begin dancing, complete with feet shuffling and tapping.

This dance makes it impossible for the victim to do anything other than caper and prance; this cavorting worsens the Armor Class of the creature by -4, makes saving throws impossible except on a roll of 20, and negates any consideration of a shield.

Note that the creature must be touched, as if melee combat were taking place and the spellcaster were striking to do damage.

spells.name: Polymorph Any Object
spells.materials: mercury, gum arabic, and smoke.
spells.description:
**This spell** changes one object or creature into another.

When used as a polymorph other or stone to flesh spell, simply treat the spell as a more powerful version, with saving throws made with -4 penalties to the die roll.

When it is cast in order to change other objects, the duration of the spell depends on how radical a change is made from the original state to its enchanted state, as well as how different it is in size.

The DM determines the changes by using the following guidelines:See book for table.

A change in kingdom makes the spell work for hours (if removed by one kingdom) or turns (if removed by two).

Other changes likewise affect spell duration.

Thus, changing a lion to an androsphinx would be permanent, but turning a turnip to a purple worm would be a change with a duration measured in hours.

Turning a tusk into an elephant would be permanent, but turning a twig into a sword would be a change with a duration of several turns.

All polymorphed objects radiate a strong magic, and if a dispel magic spell is successfully cast upon them, they return to their natural form.

Note that a stone to flesh spell or its reverse will affect objects under this spell.

As with other polymorph spells, damage sustained in the new form can result in the injury or death of the polymorphed creature.

For example, it is possible to polymorph a creature into rock and grind it to dust, causing damage, perhaps even death.

If the creature was changed to dust to start with, more creative methods to damage it would be needed; perhaps the wizard could use a gust of wind spell to scatter the dust far and wide.

In general, damage occurs when the new form is altered through physical force, although the DM will have to adjudicate many of these situations.

The system shock roll must be applied to living creatures, as must the restrictions noted regarding the polymorph other and stone to flesh spells.

Also note that a polymorph effect often detracts from an item's or creature's powers, but does not add new powers, except possibly movement capabilities not present in the old form.

Thus, a vorpal sword polymorphed into a dagger would not retain vorpal capability.

Likewise, valueless items cannot be made into permanent valuable items.

The material components of this spell are mercury, gum arabic, and smoke.

spells.name: Power Word, Blind
spells.description:
**When a power word, blind spell is cast**, one or more creatures within the area of effect become sightless.

The spellcaster selects one creature as the target center, and the effect spreads outward from the center, affecting creatures with the lowest hit point totals first; the spell can also be focused to affect only an individual creature.

The spell affects up to 100 hit points of creatures; creatures who currently have 100 or more hit points are not affected and do not count against the number of creatures affected.

The duration of the spell depends upon how many hit points are affected.

If 25 or fewer hit points are affected, the blindness is permanent until cured.

If 26 to 50 hit points are affected, the blindness lasts for 1d4+1 turns.

If 51 to 100 hit points are affected, the spell lasts for 1d4+1 rounds.

An individual creature cannot be partially affected.

If all of its current hit points are affected, it is blinded; otherwise, it is not.

Blindness can be removed by a cure blindness or dispel magic spell.

spells.name: Prismatic Wall
spells.description:
**This spell** enables the wizard to conjure a vertical, opaque wall--a shimmering,multicolored plane of light that protects him from all forms of attack.

The wall flashes with all colors of the visible spectrum, seven of which have a distinct power and purpose.The wall is immobile, and the spellcaster can pass through the wall without harm.

However, any creature with fewer than 8 Hit Dice that is within 20 feet of the wall and does not shield its vision is blinded for 2d4 rounds by the colors.Each color in the wall has a special effect.

Each color can also be negated by a specific magical effect, but the colors must be negated in the precise order of the spectrum.

The accompanying table shows the seven colors of the wall, the order in which they appear,their effects on creatures trying to attack the spellcaster, and the magic needed to negate each color.The wall's maximum proportions are 4 feet wide per level of experience of the caster and 2 feet high per level of experience.

A prismatic wall spell cast to materialize in a space occupied by a creature is disrupted and the spell is wasted.

spells.name: Screen
spells.description:
**This spell** combines several elements to create a powerful protection from scrying and direct observation.

When the spell is cast, the wizard dictates what will and will not be observed in the area of effect.

The illusion created must be stated in general terms.

Thus, the caster could specify the illusion of him and another playing chess for the duration of the spell, but he could not have the illusionary chess players take a break, make dinner,and then resume their game.

He could have a crossroads appear quiet and empty even while an army is actually passing through the area.

He could specify that no one be seen (including passing strangers), that his troops be undetected, or even that every fifth man or unit should be visible.

Once the conditions are set, they cannot be changed.

Attempts to scry the area automatically detect the image stated by the caster with no saving throw allowed.

Sight and sound are appropriate to the illusion created.

A band of men standing in a meadow could be concealed as an empty meadow with birds chirping, etc.

Direct observation may allow a saving throw (as per a normal illusion), if there is cause to disbelieve what is seen.

Certainly onlookers in the area would become suspicious if the column of a marching army disappeared at one point to reappear at another! Even entering the area does not cancel the illusion or necessarily allow a saving throw, assuming the hidden beings take care to stay out of the way of those affected by the illusion.

spells.name: Serten's Spell Immunity
spells.materials: a diamond of at least 500 gp value
spells.description:
By use of this spell, the wizard is able to confer virtual immunity to certain spells and magical attack forms upon those he touches.

For every four levels of experience of the wizard, one creature can be protected by the Serten's spell immunity spell; however, if more than one is protected, the duration of the protection is divided among the protected creatures.

For example, a 16th-level wizard can cast the spell upon one creature and it will last 16 turns, or place it upon two creatures for eight turns, or four creatures for four turns.) The protection gives a bonus to saving throws, according to spell type and level, as shown in the following table.

The material component of this spell is a diamond of at least 500 gp value, which must be crushed and sprinkled over the spell recipients.

Each such creature must also have in its possession a diamond of at least one carat size, intact and carried on its person.

spells.name: Sink
spells.aoe: 1 creature or object,  max. 1 cu. ft./level
spells.description:
Forces a creature or object to **sink into the earth** or floor it stands upon.

- Requires chanting for the full round.
- Affected target must make a **save vs. spell** (creature) or **disintegration** (magic item) or become **anchored**.

- If the caster **ceases**, effect ends in 4 turns.
- If continued, the subject **sinks over the round** in quarters:
  1. Before initiative, ¼ height.
  2. After first group, another ¼.
  3. After second group, another ¼.
  4. End of round: fully submerged.

This entombment places the subject in **suspended animation**, ceasing bodily functions.
**Detect magic** reveals a faint aura. Spells like **freedom**, **dig**, or **transmute rock to mud** may recover the subject.

spells.name: Symbol
spells.materials: powdered black opal and diamond dust,
spells.description:
A symbol spell creates magical runes affecting creatures that pass over, touch, or read the runes, or pass through a portal upon which the symbol is inscribed.

Upon casting the spell, the wizard inscribes the symbol upon whatever surface he desires.

Likewise, the spellcaster is able to place the symbol of his choice, using any one of the following: Death One or more creatures, whose total hit points do not exceed 80, are slain.

Discord All creatures are affected and immediately fall to loud bickering and arguing; there is a 50% probability that creatures of different alignments attack each other.

The bickering lasts for 5d4 rounds, the fighting for 2d4 rounds.

Fear This symbol creates an extra-strong fear spell, causing all creatures to save vs.

spell with -4 penalties to the die roll, or panic and flee as if attacked by a fear spell.

Hopelessness All creatures are affected and must turn back in dejection unless they save vs.

spell.

Affected creatures submit to the demands of any opponent--for example, surrender, get out, etc.

The hopelessness lasts for 3d4 turns; during this period it is 25% probable that affected creatures take no action during any round, and 25% likely that those taking action turn back or retire from battle, as applicable.

Insanity One or more creatures whose total hit points do not exceed 120 become insane and remain so, acting as if a confusion spell had been placed upon them, until a heal, restoration, or wish spell is used to remove the madness.

Pain All creatures are afflicted with wracking pains shooting through their bodies, causing a -2 penalty to Dexterity and a -4 penalty to attack rolls for 2d10 turns.

Sleep All creatures under 8+1 Hit Dice immediately fall into a catatonic slumber and cannot be awakened for 1d12+4 turns Stunning One or more creatures whose total hit points do not exceed 160 are stunned and reeling for 3d4 rounds, dropping anything they are holding.

The type of symbol cannot be recognized without being read and thus activating its effects.

The material components of this spell are powdered black opal and diamond dust,worth not less than 5,000 gp each.

spells.name: Trap the Soul
spells.materials: The gem
spells.description:
**This spell** forces the creature's life force (and its material body) into a special prison gem enchanted by the spellcaster.

The creature must be seen by the caster when the final word is uttered.

The spell can be triggered in one of two ways.

First, the final word of the spell can be spoken when the creature is within spell range.

This allows magic resistance (if any) and a saving throw vs.

spell to avoid the effect.

If the creature's real name is spoken as well, any magic resistance is ignored and the saving throw vs.

spell suffers a penalty of -2.

If the saving throw is successful, the prison gem shatters.

The second method is far more insidious, for it tricks the victim into accepting a trigger object inscribed with the final spell word, automatically placing the creature's soul in the trap.

To use this method, both the creature's true name and the trigger word must be inscribed on the trigger item when the gem is enchanted.

A sympathy spell can also be placed on the trigger item.

As soon as the subject creature picks up or accepts the trigger item, its life force is automatically transferred to the gem, without the benefit of magic resistance or saving throw.

The gem prison will hold the trapped entity indefinitely, or until the gem is broken and the life force is released, allowing the material body to reform.

If the trapped creature is a powerful creature from another plane (which could mean a character trapped by an inhabitant of another plane when the character is not on the Prime Material Plane), it can be required to perform a service immediately upon being freed.

Otherwise, the creature can go free once the gem imprisoning it is broken.

Before the actual casting of the trap the soul spell, the wizard must prepare the prison, a gem of at least 1,000 gp value for every Hit Die or level of experience possessed by the creature to be trapped (for example, it requires a gem of 10,000 gp value to trap a 10 Hit Die or 10th-level creature).

If the gem is not valuable enough, it shatters when the entrapment is attempted.

(Note that while characters have no concept of level as such, the value of the gem needed to trap an individual can be researched.

Remember that this value can change over time as characters advance.) Creating the prison gem requires an enchant an item spell and the placement of a maze spell into the gem, thereby forming the prison to contain the life force.

spells.name: Wildzone
spells.materials: several pots of paint
spells.description:
This powerful spell creates a disruption in magical forces similar to the conditions found in wild magic regions (areas where the effects of magic have been permanently altered).

**This spell** has only a temporary effect, although the effects of wildzone could possibly be rendered permanent.

The spell creates a wild magic region centered on the caster.

The area of effect cannot be shaped in any way; it is always a square 300 feet long on each side (90,000 square feet).

Within the wildzone, wild magic reigns.

Any spell cast in the area of effect is automatically treated as a wild surge (see Table 2).

Effects from magical items that expend charges are also treated as wild surges when used in the area.

Other magical items function normally.

Spells cast into the wildzone from outside the area of effect function normally, but spells cannot be cast out of the area of effect without triggering a wild surge.

The material components are several pots of paint which must be spilled across a sheet of hammered silver worth no less than 2,000 gp.

spells.name: Astral Spell
spells.description:
Projects the caster’s **astral body** into the **Astral Plane**, leaving the physical body behind in **suspended animation**.

- Only **magical items** may accompany the caster.
- Astral travel allows movement to the **Outer Planes** or within the **Prime Material Plane**.
- Only **one body** can be formed on a plane.
- **Silvery cord** connects the astral and physical bodies. If broken, the caster **dies**.
- The caster may bring **up to 7 companions**, joined in a circle.

The spell lasts until the caster ends it or it's **dispelled** or disrupted. Magic items may be **nonfunctional** in distant planes, with exceptions for powerful artifacts.

spells.name: Bigby's Crushing Hand
spells.materials: a glove of snake skin and the shell of an egg.
spells.description:
### Bigby’s Crushing Hand (Evocation)

Creates a massive hand under the caster’s mental control, which **grasps and crushes** a target.

**Damage by round**:
- Round 1: 1d10
- Rounds 2–3: 2d10
- Round 4+: 4d10

- The hand has AC 0 and HP equal to the caster’s full HP.
- It vanishes if destroyed.
- If struck by an **area spell**, the creature it holds **shares the result**.
- Ineffective against **noncorporeal or gaseous** forms.

It may grasp **objects**, forcing saves vs. a Strength 25 crush.

**Material components**: a **glove of snake skin** and the **shell of an egg**.

spells.name: Chain Contingency
spells.materials: quicksilver
spells.description:
Functions like *contingency*, but allows **two or three spells** to be preloaded under a **single trigger**.

- Choose **2 spells simultaneously** or **3 in sequence** (1/round).
- Trigger conditions must be clearly worded.
- Stored spells must be **8th level or lower**, and **cannot include contingency**.
- Stored spells may target **others**, not just the caster.

**Material components**: 500 gp of quicksilver, a gem worth 1,000 gp, an eyelash of a magical creature, and an ivory figurine of the caster (not consumed).

spells.name: Crystalbrittle
spells.description:
Turns any **metal object** into **fragile crystal**.

- Works on metal from **gold to adamantite**.
- Affected items **shatter easily** if struck.
- The effect is **permanent**, only reversed by a **wish** spell.

To affect worn or used items, the caster must **touch** and **hit in melee**.

**Saving throws** (chance to resist) are based on **magical bonus**:
- Example: +5 armor = 25% chance.
- Golems and artifacts may resist at DM discretion.

Items that fail to save and are struck are **instantly destroyed**.

spells.name: Elemental Aura
spells.description:
Cloaks the caster in a 3-inch-thick aura of one element: **Air, Earth, Fire, or Water**.

**Only one aura may be active at a time.**

**Air**: Immunity to air/gas attacks, protection from Air creatures, cast *fly* and *protection from normal missiles* once.

**Earth**: Immunity to nonmagical metal/stone weapons, protection from Earth creatures, move/breathe in earth, cast *wall of stone* once.

**Fire**: Immunity to fire, protection from Fire creatures, survive in fire environments, cast *wall of fire* once.

**Water**: Immunity to water/cold attacks, protection from Water creatures, breathe/move in water, cast *wall of ice* once.

The caster remains fully mobile and unhindered.

spells.name: Energy Drain
spells.materials: essence of spectre or vampire dust.
spells.description:
Opens a conduit to the **Negative Energy Plane**, draining **2 levels** (or HD) from a touched living creature.

- **Monsters** lose 2 Hit Dice permanently.
- **Characters** lose levels, HP, and abilities. Lost spells are forgotten and must be re-learned.
- Characters reduced to 0 levels become **ordinary humans** and cannot gain levels again without magical help.
- At <0 levels, the victim **dies** and rises as an **undead** of the caster’s type after 2d4 days.
- Victims slain may be raised as **juju zombies** under the caster's control.

**Material component**: Essence of **spectre** or **vampire dust**.

Casting has a **5% chance** of backfiring: the caster loses 1 point of Constitution. If this equals the caster’s original score, they become a **shade**.

spells.name: Foresight
spells.materials: a hummingbird's feather.
spells.description:
Grants **sixth sense warnings** to the caster or a chosen target.

- Prevents **surprise** and grants a **+2 AC bonus** if the caster is the subject.
- Warns of danger from attacks, traps, spells, or ambushes.
- If cast on another, the caster must **warn them** to avoid surprise.

**Material component**: A **hummingbird's feather**.

spells.name: Gate
spells.description:
Creates a portal to another plane, summoning a **powerful being** named by the caster.

- The entity can **step through** instantly.
- Something always appears—if no servant, the being itself comes.
- Reaction depends on the **importance of the request**:
  - Trivial: may attack or leave.
  - Middling: may assist but demand payment.
  - Urgent: takes action, asks favor in return.

Factors include the **alignment and goals** of both caster and being.

**Ages the caster by 5 years.**

spells.name: Imprisonment
spells.description:
Entombs a creature in **suspended animation** deep underground.

- Must **touch** the target and **know its name and background**.
- The victim is placed in a **small sphere** beneath the earth.
- Cannot be detected by **divination**, **locate object**, or similar spells.

**Reversed by** *freedom*, which must be cast **on the exact spot**, with perfect pronunciation.
- If failed, **1–100 random creatures** may be freed.
- Only **10%** may appear nearby; rest are elsewhere.

This is a **permanent** effect unless dispelled properly.

spells.name: Meteor Swarm
spells.description:
Launches either **4 large (2-ft.)** or **8 small (1-ft.) fire spheres** in a straight line.

- **Direct hits** deal **full damage with no save**.

**Large spheres**:
- 10d4 damage each
- 30-ft. blast area
- Burst in box/diamond pattern with overlap

**Small spheres**:
- 5d4 damage each
- 15-ft. blast area
- Burst in nested box/diamond pattern

Saves apply to area damage (half damage on save); center targets may be hit by multiple bursts.

spells.name: Monster Summoning VII
spells.description: **This spell** is much like the 3rd-level spell monster summoning I, except that this spell summons one or two 7th-level monsters that appear one round after the spell is cast, or one 8th-level monster that appears two rounds after the spell is cast.

spells.name: Mordenkainen's Disjunction
spells.description:
When this spell is cast, all magic and magical items within the radius of the spell, except those on the person of or being touched by the spellcaster, are disjoined.

That is, spells being cast are separated into their individual components (usually spoiling the effect as a dispel magic spell does), and permanent and enchanted magical items must successfully save (vs.

spell if actually cast on a creature, or vs.

a dispel magic spell otherwise) or be turned into normal items.

Even artifacts and relics are subject to Mordenkainen's disjunction, though there is only a 1% chance per caster experience level of actually affecting such powerful items.

Thus, all potions, scrolls, rings, rods, miscellaneous magical items, artifacts and relics, arms and armor, swords, and miscellaneous weapons within 30 feet of the spellcaster can possibly lose all their magical properties when the Mordenkainen's disjunction spell is cast.

The caster also has a 1% chance per level of destroying an antimagic shell.

If the shell survives the disjunction, no items within it are disjoined.

Note: Destroying artifacts is a dangerous business, and 95% likely to attract the attention of some powerful being who has an interest or connection with the device.

Additionally, if an artifact is destroyed, the casting wizard must roll a successful saving throw vs.

spell with a -4 penalty or permanently lose all spellcasting abilities.

spells.name: Power Word, Kill
spells.description:
When a power word, kill spell is uttered, one or more creatures of any type within the spell range and area of effect are slain.

The power word kills either one creature with up to 60 hit points, or multiple creatures with 10 or fewer hit points each, to a maximum of 120 hit points total.

The option to attack a single creature or multiple creatures must be stated along with the spell range and center of the area of effect.

The current hit points of the creatures are used.

spells.name: Prismatic Sphere
spells.description:
**This spell** enables the wizard to conjure up an immobile, opaque globe of shimmering, multicolored light to surround him, giving protection from all forms of attack.

The sphere flashes in all colors of the visible spectrum, seven of which have distinct powers and purposes.

Any creature with fewer than 8 Hit Dice is blinded for 2d4 turns by the colors of the sphere.

Only the spellcaster can pass in and out of the prismatic sphere without harm, though he can cast it over others to protect them.

The sphere can be destroyed, color by color, in consecutive order, by various magical effects; however, the first must be brought down before the second can be affected, and so on.

Any creature passing through the barrier receives the effect of every color still remaining.

The following table shows the colors and effects of the prismatic sphere, as well as what will negate each globe.

Note that typically the upper hemisphere of the globe is visible, as the spellcaster is at the center of the sphere, so the lower half is usually hidden by the floor surface he is standing on.

Furthermore, a rod of cancellation or a Mordenkainen's disjunction spell will destroy a prismatic sphere (but an antimagic shell will fail to penetrate it).

Otherwise, anything short of an artifact or relic entering the sphere is destroyed, and any creature is subject to the effects of every color still active--i.e., 70-140 points of damage plus death, petrification, insanity, and instantaneous transportation to another plane.

spells.name: Programmed Amnesia
spells.description:
Developed by archmentalist **Rheizom**, this spell allows the caster to selectively **destroy, implant, or alter memories**, skills, and personality traits.

**Effects include**:
- **Memory erasure**: Remove specific memories.
- **Memory implant**: Add false memories.
- **Skill erasure**: Remove class-based skills, THAC0 resets to 20.
- **Persona erasure**: Leaves target a blank slate; becomes 1st-level character.
- **Persona implant**: Replaces identity; caster selects class, alignment, and memories.
- **Programmed erasure**: Triggers based on events (e.g., location, message).

**Casting**:
- 1 effect = **2 days seclusion**, 8 hrs/day casting.
- Each additional effect = +1 day.
- Breaking seclusion **fails the spell**.
- Subject must be **visible to the caster**.
- Saves are rolled **after each day**.

**Effects are permanent**, removable only by *wish*, *restoration*, or **psychic surgery**.
Upon memory return, a save determines if new skills are kept or lost.

spells.name: Shape Change
spells.materials: a jade circlet
spells.description:
Allows the caster to assume the form of any **living creature** below **demigod** status.

- The caster gains **physical abilities** (movement, natural AC, attacks) but retains **mental stats**.
- Cannot use **innate magical abilities** or **magic resistance** of the form.
- Hit points remain unchanged.
- **No system shock roll** required.
- Changing form takes only **1 second**.

The caster adopts the form's **vulnerabilities** (e.g., a spectre form is powerless in daylight).

**If killed** in an altered form, the caster **does not revert** to original form, complicating resurrection.

**Material component**: A **jade circlet** worth at least 5,000 gp, which shatters when the spell ends. If shattered prematurely, the spell ends.

spells.name: Sphere of Ultimate Destruction
spells.materials: a dark crystal ball
spells.description:
Conjures a **black sphere of annihilation**, 2 feet in diameter, that **destroys anything it touches**.

- Moves up to **15 feet/round** as directed.
- Targeted creatures may **save vs. breath weapon** to dodge.
- Unaware or immobile victims are **destroyed without save**.
- Control chance: **75% + Int bonus** (+1% per Int over 12, +3% per point over 15).
- Failure: Sphere moves **toward the caster**.

**Special Interactions**:
- *Gate* spell: 50% destroys sphere, 35% nothing, 15% tears planar rift (180-ft. radius).
- *Rod of Cancellation*: Explodes for **3d4 × 10 damage** in 60-ft. radius.
- **5% chance** of banishing a victim to a random plane instead of destroying them.

**Material component**: A **dark crystal ball** that has been to the Ethereal Plane and can be held in two hands.

spells.name: Stabilize
spells.description:
Negates the effects of **wild magic regions** for the caster and others within **30 feet**.

- **No wild surges** occur during the spell.
- Caster's spells function at **true level**.
- Applies to **wildstrike, wildzone, and wildwind** effects.
- Spell **moves with the caster**.

**Duration**: 1d4 + 1 turns.

spells.name: Temporal Stasis
spells.materials: a powder composed of diamond
spells.description:
Places a creature in **suspended animation**, halting aging and bodily functions.

- Duration is **permanent** until *dispel magic* or *temporal reinstatement* is cast.
- Target is unaffected by time, neither ages nor acts.

**Material component**: Powder made from **diamond, emerald, ruby, and sapphire dust**, each worth at least 100 gp.

spells.name: Time Stop
spells.description:
The caster **freezes time** in a **15-foot radius** for **1d3 rounds of apparent time**.

- Only the **caster may act** inside the area.
- All other creatures are **frozen in time**.
- The effect ends if the caster **leaves the area**.
- **Nothing can enter** during the duration.

Recommended: DM uses a timer to enforce duration.
*Teleport* may be used to leave before it expires.

spells.name: Wail of the Banshee
spells.materials: a lock of hair from an evil female elf.
spells.description:
At the culmination of this dreadful spell, the wizard emits a supernatural scream like a banshee.

- For each **caster level**, one creature within **30 feet** hears the wail.
- Affected creatures must **save vs. death magic** or **die instantly**.
- The caster **cannot target specific individuals**; affected creatures are determined randomly.
- **Deaf or protected creatures** can be targeted but are **immune**.

**Material component**: A **lock of hair from an evil female elf**.

spells.name: Weird
spells.description:
Confronts affected creatures with **phantasmal images** of their most feared enemies.

- The caster must **speak to the victims** during casting.
- Even on a successful save, targets are **paralyzed with fear for 1 round** and lose **1d4 Strength**.
- On a failed save, victims **must fight their nemeses** in an imaginary but deadly combat.
- **No magical escape** is possible during the illusion.
- If the foe is defeated, the victim survives unharmed.

**Combat rounds** occur in **one-tenth of a round**. If the illusion lasts **over 10 rounds**, saved creatures may act.
- If the caster is disturbed, the spell **ends**.
- Paralyzed creatures lose paralysis if attacked.

spells.name: Wildfire
spells.description:
Channels raw magical energy into **any form or effect**, similar to *wish*, but with differences.

- Can replicate **any 8th-level or lower wizard spell**.
- No need to know or prepare the spell—just general knowledge of the effect.
- Saving throws vs. effects are made at **-2 penalty**.
- Can create **non-spell effects** and **magic items**.

**Wildfire creations**:
- Form solid, green-glowing objects stronger than steel and nearly weightless.
- Immune to fire, cold, electricity, and most magic.
- Vulnerable only to *dispel magic* and *wish*, with a saving throw.
- Last **1d6 + 4 hours**, then decay.
- Cannot exceed **10-ft. radius sphere** in size.

spells.name: Wildwind
spells.description:
Summons a **150-ft. line of multicolored lights** similar to *wildstrike* and *wildzone*.

- Appears at a point chosen by the caster.
- Can **move 60 ft./round**, direction adjustable up to **45 degrees**.
- Cannot be stopped once set in motion except by **dispel magic**.

**Effects**:
- All creatures struck take **2d6 damage**.
- Spellcasters struck while casting trigger a **wild surge**.
- Magical items with charges that touch the wall expend one charge and cause a **wild surge**.

spells.name: Wish
spells.description:
The **most powerful** spell, capable of **altering reality** to a great extent.

- **No penalty** for healing, resurrection, or teleportation of the caster’s party.
- Other uses cause **-3 Strength** and require **2d4 days of bed rest**.
- The **exact wording** is crucial; unintended consequences are likely.
- **Ages the caster five years**.

**DM discretion** is essential. Overly ambitious or unfair wishes (e.g., instant death for others) may backfire or remove the caster from the campaign entirely.

spells.name: Animate Dead Animals
spells.description:
This spell creates undead skeletons and zombies from the bones and bodies of dead animals, specifically vertebrates (fish, amphibians, reptiles, birds, and mammals). The animated remains obey simple verbal commands given by the caster, regardless of the language employed.

Only naturally occurring animals of no higher than semi-intelligence can be animated (e.g., cats, frogs, tigers), including giant-sized animals. These undead remain animated until destroyed in combat or turned; the animating magic cannot be dispelled.

**Skeletons Created per Caster Level**:
- 1/4 HD or less: 4
- 1/2 to 1 HD: 2
- 1+ to 3 HD: 1
- 3+ to 6 HD: 1 per 2 levels
- Over 6 HD: 1 per 4 levels

**Zombies Created per Caster Level**:
- 1/4 HD or less: 2
- 1/2 to 1 HD: 1
- 1 to 3 HD: 1 per 2 levels
- Over 3 HD: 1 per 4 levels

Skeletons and zombies gain standard undead immunities, lose special attacks, and have penalties to AC, damage, and movement. The material components are a blood drop and bone chip from the same species as the remains.

spells.name: Asphyxiate
spells.description:
This spell causes a target’s throat to constrict and lungs to swell shut, mimicking a deadly allergic reaction. Affected creatures must be within range and fail a saving throw vs. death magic.

If fewer than six creatures are targeted, they receive penalties to their save: –1 for 4–5, –2 for 2–3, –4 if only one is targeted.

Each round, victims must roll a Constitution check:
- Fail: 1d6 damage
- Success: 1d3 damage

Victims are **slowed** while struggling to breathe. Failure on **three consecutive Constitution checks** causes death on the following round.

The effect ends if the target leaves the area or if *dispel magic* is used. Slowed status persists 1–3 rounds afterward. Creatures that do not breathe (e.g., undead, plants) are immune.

Material components: An unholy symbol and a symbolic silken gag wrapped around the caster’s mouth after casting.

- Success: 1d3 damage

Victims are **slowed** while struggling to breathe. Failure on **three consecutive Constitution checks** causes death on the following round.

The effect ends if the target leaves the area or if *dispel magic* is used. Slowed status persists 1–3 rounds afterward. Creatures that do not breathe (e.g., undead, plants) are immune.

Material components: An unholy symbol and a symbolic silken gag wrapped around the caster’s mouth after casting.

spells.name: Bind Undead
spells.description:
This spell affects only undead (not living creatures). It automatically immobilizes all **corporeal undead of 6 HD or less** (e.g., skeletons, ghouls, zombies) with **no saving throw**. They curl into a "boneball" of 2–3 feet per creature, held helpless with abilities suspended.

These undead can be rolled or moved into enemy areas and then released.

For **noncorporeal undead** or those of **7+ HD**, the spell works like *slow*, and such creatures get a **saving throw**. "Special" undead are unaffected.

Material component: A bone held in the wizard’s left hand during casting.

spells.name: Bone Dance
spells.description:
This spell temporarily animates a skeleton or zombie, which the caster controls like a puppet. The caster must concentrate to direct its every action (e.g., move, attack), and cannot speak, cast spells, or act while concentrating.

The undead creature fights as a normal skeleton or zombie. It can perform basic tasks like walking, wielding weapons, or scouting (especially when combined with *corpse link*).

Loses effect if the caster is distracted, loses sight of the creature, or if *dispel magic* succeeds.

Material components: An intact skeleton or corpse and a small puppet manipulated with both hands.

spells.name: Brainkill
spells.description:
The caster touches a living creature’s head and attempts to destroy the brain through necromantic energy. A failed save causes **instant death** as the brain is effectively annihilated.

Creatures immune to mind-affecting spells (like constructs or mindless undead) are unaffected. This spell has no effect on creatures without a discernible brain.

There is **no physical damage** visible from the outside, but the interior of the skull is reduced to mush. Raise dead is ineffective; resurrection or wish may be needed.

spells.name: Cause Insanity
spells.description:
This spell drives a victim insane. The DM may consult the madness table in Chapter Three or choose a form of insanity to suit the wicked caster.

Examples include:
- **Fear of dying**: Victim must save vs. paralyzation to resist a fear spell when seeing death imagery.
- **Corpse paranoia**: Believes all corpses are undead, causing paranoia.
- **Combat disablement**: Inflict *confusion* or *feeblemindedness* for quick neutralization.

**The insanity is permanent** unless cured by *cure insanity* (reverse of this spell), *heal*, *restoration*, or *wish*.

**Reverse effect**: *Cure insanity* restores sanity immediately (no save). It also:
- Ends most magical, psionic, or poison-induced madness
- Heals psychic trauma (e.g., from *mindwipe*)
- Restores 5–40 PSPs
- Temporarily calms some extraplanar madness (DM’s call)

It does **not** cure madness from lycanthropy, undeath, or powerful curses like *geas*【127:7†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Corpse Host
spells.description:
This spell transfers a recipient's life force into a **fresh corpse**, animating it like a puppet. While in control, the real body becomes paralyzed but remains aware. The caster or another touched target becomes the “master” of the corpse.

- Range: 5 miles/level
- Corpse retains HP equal to master's full total
- Can speak hoarsely, fight, and perform most actions (except fine motor tasks)
- Cannot pass for a living being without illusion magic

The caster may switch back at any time or is forced to if the corpse is destroyed or moved beyond range.

If the host dies:
- A **system shock roll** is required or the caster dies
- Can be severed by *dispel magic*, *wish*, or *spirit release*

**Components**: A fresh corpse (dead ≤ 1 day per level) and a **fresh patch of the recipient’s skin**, which causes 1–3 hp damage and potentially permanent hp loss on failed save【127:8†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Death Shroud
spells.description:
This aura of **life-draining darkness** surrounds the caster and functions both **offensively and defensively**.

- **Offensive use**: Touch attack forces save vs. death magic **at –4**. On fail, victim loses **20% of current HP per round** for 5 rounds.
- **Defensive use**: Anyone who touches or strikes the caster must save or suffer the same effect (no penalty).

Spell ends when:
- Caster affects or is attacked by a number of creatures = caster level
- Duration ends (2 rounds/level)
- Caster dies or *dispel magic* is used

**Undead are immune**, and **gain 1 HD** if affected, potentially harming the caster.

**Components**: Crushed black opal & diamond (5,000 gp), dust from corporeal undead tied to the Negative Material Plane, and smoky quartz【127:10†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Death's Door
spells.description:
This spell revives a mortally wounded character at –1 to –9 hp back to **0 hp**, stopping bleeding and stabilizing them.

The subject remains unconscious but can be healed normally. Optionally, if cast within 1–10 rounds of death, it may **revive the newly dead**, subject to a **system shock roll** and **–1 Constitution** loss.

**Components**: Holy/unholy symbol, a strip of white linen, and any unguent【127:15†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Death's Door
spells.description:
This spell revives a mortally wounded character at –1 to –9 hp back to **0 hp**, stopping bleeding and stabilizing them.

The subject remains unconscious but can be healed normally. Optionally, if cast within 1–10 rounds of death, it may **revive the newly dead**, subject to a **system shock roll** and **–1 Constitution** loss.

**Components**: Holy/unholy symbol, a strip of white linen, and any unguent【127:15†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Empathic Wound Transfer
spells.description:
Transfers damage from a touched target to the caster.

- Max transfer: **2 hp/level**
- Damage types: Physical, some poisons, disease, curse effects
- Cannot restore lost limbs, life levels, or irreversible conditions
- Only reverses harm temporarily if it's ongoing (e.g., poison continues)

Caster may transfer up to current HP (or –9 if using “hovering on death’s door” rule).

DM may allow this spell to act like *death's door* to stabilize the dying.

**Damage is taken by the caster**, who may recover via rest or healing magic【127:16†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Exterminate
spells.aoe: 1 small creature or 1 cubic foot per level (up to 10 creatures or 10 cubic feet maximum).
spells.description:
This spell snuffs out the life forces of **small rodents and vermin**, such as flies, mice, beetles, rats, spiders, and similar pests. It only affects creatures with **1–3 hp per caster level** (maximum 9 hp) and **animal intelligence**.

- If the creatures are extremely small (1 hp or less), the caster may affect **1 cubic foot per level**, up to 10 cubic feet.

Useful both indoors and outdoors, the spell is favored by necromancers dealing with pestilence. Some evil mages misuse it on benign animals or pets.

**Components**:
- Somatic: Pointed finger
- Verbal: Low “zzzt” sound
- Material: Pinch of lavender and dried garlic【133:15†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Heart Blight
spells.description:
This spell targets the **heart of a living creature**, requiring line of sight. The caster must concentrate for **three rounds**. During that time, the caster may walk or talk but not cast spells or fight.

- **1st round**: Victim saves vs. death magic at –2 (+Con modifier). Failure causes **1d8 damage** and incapacitates the target for 1 round.
- **2nd round**: Another save at –1 (+Con mod). Failure causes:
  - **25% HP loss**
  - **2–5 rounds of paralysis**
  - **2–5 point loss** each to Strength, Constitution, and Dexterity
- **3rd round**: Final save (no penalty). Failure causes:
  - **Immediate death** via heart attack
  - Or **coma for 1–4 days** and permanent **–1 Constitution**

The spell ends early if line of sight is broken, the caster is disrupted, or the victim receives healing attention. The spell can be disrupted by *dispel magic*, *protection from evil*, or a *scarab of protection* (at cost of a charge)【133:10†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Heart Blight
spells.description:
This spell targets the **heart of a living creature**, requiring line of sight. The caster must concentrate for **three rounds**. During that time, the caster may walk or talk but not cast spells or fight.

- **1st round**: Victim saves vs. death magic at –2 (+Con modifier). Failure causes **1d8 damage** and incapacitates the target for 1 round.
- **2nd round**: Another save at –1 (+Con mod). Failure causes:
  - **25% HP loss**
  - **2–5 rounds of paralysis**
  - **2–5 point loss** each to Strength, Constitution, and Dexterity
- **3rd round**: Final save (no penalty). Failure causes:
  - **Immediate death** via heart attack
  - Or **coma for 1–4 days** and permanent **–1 Constitution**

The spell ends early if line of sight is broken, the caster is disrupted, or the victim receives healing attention. The spell can be disrupted by *dispel magic*, *protection from evil*, or a *scarab of protection* (at cost of a charge)【133:10†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Life Drain
spells.description:
By touching a victim, the caster **drains 1d8 + 1 hp per level** from the target. These hit points can be:

- Bestowed immediately on the caster
- Transferred to another recipient within **1–4 rounds**

The total can **exceed the maximum HP** of the recipient, but only for **1 turn per caster level**. Damage is absorbed from bonus HP first.

If the **victim is unwilling**, a successful saving throw reduces damage to **half**. The spell doesn’t affect or benefit undead, but undead priests may still use it to **heal living allies**【133:7†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Life Drain
spells.description:

- Transferred to another recipient within **1–4 rounds**

If the **victim is unwilling**, a successful saving throw reduces damage to **half**. The spell doesn’t affect or benefit undead, but undead priests may still use it to **heal living allies**【133:7†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Life Force Exchange
spells.description:
This spell **switches the life forces** of **two creatures**. Both targets must fail their saving throws **(–6 penalty)** for the exchange to work. If only one fails:

- One who passed: **Stunned 1 round**
- One who failed: **Stunned 1–4 rounds**

If successful, the transferred minds retain their personalities, but their physical stats match the new bodies. Unaccustomed targets are stunned 1 round post-transfer.

**Reversal**: Only a **full wish** or *revoke life force exchange* can undo it. If a body dies, that life force is lost unless **cloned** and then reversed with the spell【133:4†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Life Force Transfer
spells.description:
This powerful and lengthy incantation allows the caster to **transfer a creature’s life force** (including their own) into:

- A **magical item**
- A **new body**
- A **specially prepared receptacle**

The original body becomes comatose for **2–7 days**. If the life force is not reunited with the body, it **dies**.

While in a receptacle:
- **Items**: Limited communication via empathy (if any)
- **Statues/golems**: May animate and act
- **Living hosts**: Become possessed (save at –4)

Used in creating magical items (e.g., sentient swords). The spell is irreversible unless undone via *wish*, *clone*, or destruction of the receptacle.

**Defensive use**: A caster may pre-cast the spell and speak the final syllable to survive death. However, the spell slot is locked until used.

**Components**:
- Scroll with rare inks
- **Massive garnet** (5,000+ gp), consumed in casting【133:1†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Plague Curse
spells.description:
This spell places a powerful curse on a person or object, transforming the target into a **carrier of a fatal plague**.

Anyone who comes into **physical contact** with the carrier must save vs. death magic or contract a **deadly disease**, akin to *cause disease*, resulting in death within **2–5 weeks**.

- The **carrier is immune** to the disease
- Carrier may be **unaware** of their condition
- The curse is **faintly detectable** (5% per caster level)

The curse remains until it **claims one life per caster level** or is removed:
- Only removable by a **higher-level priest**
- **Dispel magic is ineffective**
- Objects may be cleansed by **burning**

**Material components**: The priest's **unholy symbol** and a **small ball of myrrh**. Caster **ages one year** upon casting【139:7†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Scourge
spells.description:
Victims of this spell are afflicted with a **horrific magical disease** if they fail a **save vs. spell at –3**:

- Covered in **boils, lesions, cysts**
- **Strength, Dexterity, and Charisma –3**
- **Attack rolls –3**

Cured only by *cure disease*, *heal*, or *restoration* from a **more powerful priest** than the caster. **Dispel magic** and *remove curse* do **not** work; *wish* will cure it instantly.

Neglected scourges can lead to **long-term illness** and **death within 1–4 weeks**. In populated areas, a **1% chance per caster level** exists of **triggering an epidemic**.

**Material component**: A specially prepared **black whip or crop**, cracked at the target during casting【139:3†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Skeletal Servant
spells.description:
This spell animates the skeleton of a **man-sized or smaller** dead human, demihuman, or humanoid.

- Obeys **simple commands**
- Useful as a **porter or guard**
- Ends if **destroyed, turned, dispelled, or after one week**

**Limit**: 1 skeletal servant per caster level

**Material component**: A **handful of graveyard dirt**

This spell is not considered a good act; typically only evil casters use it【139:4†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Spirit Bind
spells.description:
This spell **binds a newly deceased spirit** to its corpse, preventing it from departing.

- Cast within **1 round per caster level** of death
- Spirit gets **save vs. spell**, at –1 per 3 caster levels
- Bound corpses glow faintly and **repel animals**

While bound:
- **Immune to decay**
- Treated as **dead less than a day** for raising
- Gains **–10% bonus** on system shock rolls

May be used for **interrogation** or **flesh golem creation**

If the corpse is destroyed:
- Spirit becomes **bound to the location**
- May become **undead**

Only *dispel evil* or the **reverse of this spell** can release the spirit. *Dispel magic* is ineffective【139:2†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Summon Spirit
spells.description:
The caster raises a **spirit of a dead human or demihuman** to answer questions.

- Must speak **same language** as spirit
- **Success chance**: 50% + 1% per caster level (min 5%, max 95%)
- **Failures may attract hostile undead**

The spirit may **save vs. spell** if:
- Different **alignment**
- Had more **HD** than the caster's level

Spirit may answer **1 question per 3 caster levels**, and responses may be **cryptic**. Knowledge is limited to what was known in life, and predictions only extend to the **next nightfall**.

**Material component**: A **shallow pit of ram’s blood**, which also risks attracting hostile undead【139:15†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Undead Alacrity
spells.description:
This spell only affects skeletons and zombies, which temporarily gain the **speed and agility of a living human in a peak, healthy state** (movement rate 12).

Affected undead also gain:
- The same **Dexterity, initiative, and saving throws** as the caster (if superior to their own)
- An automatic **+1 bonus to AC**, which may improve further if the caster’s Dexterity grants a defense bonus

The material components are **three drops of water**, **sinew of any mammal**, and a **drop of quicksilver**【145:9†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Undead Regeneration
spells.description:
This spell “heals” undead by restoring **2d4 + 1 hp per caster level** to the target. Healing cannot exceed the creature’s normal maximum HP.

- Works on **corporeal and noncorporeal undead**
- The caster is temporarily **shielded** from harmful contact (e.g., paralysis, energy drain)
- **One undead only** may be affected per casting

**Reverse spell**: *Drain Undead* inflicts the same damage (which is **not gained** as healing). The protections against harmful effects remain the same【145:8†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.

spells.name: Undead Spell Focus
spells.description:
This spell turns an undead into a **remote conduit** for another spell the caster carries (called a *companion spell*). When cast:

- The **companion spell** is released **from the undead**, though the **caster performs** all casting actions
- **No range limit**, but must be on **same plane**
- Compatible with *spectral senses*, *undead alacrity*, or *resist turning*
- Undead may be under control of spell, item, or clerical ability

The spell allows stealthy casting via a decoy or controlled undead, ideal for ambushes or maintaining secrecy【145:11†TSR 2151 - The Complete Book of Necromancers.pdf】.
